snippet: Cattle herders killed 82 people and wounded 25 in a village in central Nigeria over grazing rights, the police said Tuesday.
abstract: Muslim Fulani herdsmen kill 82 people and wound 25 in attack on village in Benue State, Nigeria, an area populated by Egba ethnic group who are mostly Christian; police say assault is due to longstanding friction over grazing rights and cattle rustling between the two groups; some fear escalation of violence if politicians challenge results of impending elections by exploiting conflict.
lead_paragraph: Cattle herders killed 82 people and wounded 25 in a village in central Nigeria over grazing rights, the police said Tuesday.

headline.main: Nigeria: Herders Kill Scores in Tensions Over Grazing Rights
headline.print_headline: Africa; Nigeria: Herders Kill Scores in Tensions Over Grazing Rights
